title: Calories in Chicken Tenderloin
meta_description: Discover calories in chicken tenderloin per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken tenderloin, grilled or baked without added oil; standard portion size.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, seasoning, and brand; values are approximate. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked chicken tenderloin provides ~143 kcal and ~30 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

tweaks.label: Breaded and fried (adds ~100 kcal per 100 g)
Marinated with 1 tsp oil per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g chicken tenderloin?
faqs.a: Approximately 143 kcal for cooked, skinless chicken tenderloin.

faqs.q: Is chicken tenderloin high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 30 g protein per 100 g, making it a lean source.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in chicken tenderloin?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling keeps it low; frying or breading can add 100+ kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: What about fat content in chicken tenderloin?
faqs.a: Low at ~2.5 g total fat per 100 g, with 0.7 g saturated.

faqs.q: Are carbs present in chicken tenderloin?
faqs.a: Negligible—0 g carbs, fiber, or sugars per 100 g.
